jaxtari.atraJaxis module

class jaxtari.atraJaxis.AgnosticPath(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Path

A class that can handle input with Windows () and/or posix (/) separators for paths

jaxtari.atraJaxis.get_sprite_frame(frames, frame_idx, loop=True)[source]
jaxtari.atraJaxis.int_to_digits(n, max_digits=10)[source]

Convert an integer to a fixed-length array of digits in JAX.

If n exceeds the maximum expressible number, return all 9s.

jaxtari.atraJaxis.loadFrame(fileName, transpose=True)[source]
jaxtari.atraJaxis.load_and_pad_digits(path_pattern, num_chars=10)[source]
jaxtari.atraJaxis.pad_to_match(sprites)[source]
jaxtari.atraJaxis.render_at(raster, y, x, sprite_frame, flip_horizontal=False, flip_vertical=False)[source]

Renders a sprite onto a raster at position (x,y) with optional flipping.

Parameters:

  • raster -- JAX array of shape (width, height, 3) for the target image

  • y -- Integer y coordinate for sprite placement

  • x -- Integer x coordinate for sprite placement

  • sprite_frame -- JAX array of shape (height, width, 4) containing RGB + alpha

jaxtari.atraJaxis.render_bar(raster, y, x, value, max, width, height, color, default_color)[source]

jaxtari.environment module

class jaxtari.environment.JaxEnvironment[source]

Bases: Generic[EnvState, EnvObs, EnvInfo]

Abstract class for a JAX environment. Generics:

EnvState: The type of the environment state. EnvObs: The type of the observation. EnvInfo: The type of the additional information.

get_action_space() → Tuple[source]

Returns the action space of the environment. Returns: The action space of the environment as a tuple.

get_observation_space() → Tuple[source]

Returns the observation space of the environment. Returns: The observation space of the environment as a tuple.

render(state: EnvState) → Tuple[Array][source]

Renders the environment state to a single image. :param state: The environment state.

Returns: A single image of the environment state.

reset() → Tuple[EnvState, EnvObs][source]

Resets the environment to the initial state. Returns: The initial observation and the initial environment state.

step(state: EnvState, action) → Tuple[EnvState, EnvObs, float, bool, EnvInfo][source]

Takes a step in the environment. :param state: The current environment state. :param action: The action to take.

Returns: The observation, the new environment state, the reward, whether the state is terminal, and additional info.

jaxtari.jax_seaquest.calculate_kill_points(successful_rescues: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number) → Array | ndarray | bool_ | number[source]

Calculate the points awarded for killing a shark or submarine. Sharks and submarines are worth 20 points. The points are increased by 10 for each successful rescue with a maximum of 90.

jaxtari.jax_seaquest.check_collision_batch(pos1, size1, pos2_array, size2)[source]

Check collision between one entity and an array of entities

Get human action from keyboard with support for diagonal movement and combined fire

jaxtari.jax_seaquest.get_pattern_for_difficulty(current_pattern: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, moving_left: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number) → Array | ndarray | bool_ | number[source]

Returns spawn pattern based on the lane's current wave/pattern number

Pattern meanings: 0: Single enemy (initial pattern) 1: Two adjacent enemies 2: Two enemies with gap 3: Three enemies in a row

jaxtari.jax_seaquest.get_spawn_position(moving_left: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, slot: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number) → Array | ndarray | bool_ | number[source]

Get spawn position based on movement direction and slot number

jaxtari.jax_seaquest.player_missile_step(state: SeaquestState, curr_player_x, curr_player_y, action: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number) → Array | ndarray | bool_ | number[source]
jaxtari.jax_seaquest.player_step(state: SeaquestState, action: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number) → tuple[Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number][source]
jaxtari.jax_seaquest.soft_reset_spawn_state(spawn_state: SpawnState) → SpawnState[source]

Reset spawn_times

jaxtari.jax_seaquest.spawn_divers(spawn_state: SpawnState, diver_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, shark_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, sub_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, step_counter: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number) → tuple[Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, SpawnState][source]

Spawn divers according to pattern that depends on collection state.

Follows these rules: 1. Divers can only spawn in lanes marked as 'spawnable' in diver_array (value 1) 2. Divers only spawn in empty lanes (no enemies present) 3. Divers don't spawn in lanes where submarines will spawn next

Parameters:

  • spawn_state -- Current spawn state containing diver_array

  • diver_positions -- Current diver positions

  • shark_positions -- Current shark positions

  • sub_positions -- Current sub positions

  • step_counter -- Current step counter

Returns:

Updated diver positions and updated spawn state

jaxtari.jax_seaquest.spawn_step(state, spawn_state: SpawnState, shark_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, sub_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, diver_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, rng_key: Array) → Tuple[SpawnState, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number][source]

Main spawn handling function to be called in game step

jaxtari.jax_seaquest.step_diver_movement(diver_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, shark_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, state_player_x: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, state_player_y: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, state_divers_collected: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, spawn_state: SpawnState, step_counter: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, rng: Array) → tuple[Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, SpawnState, Array][source]

Move divers according to their pattern and handle collisions. Returns updated diver positions, number of collected divers, updated spawn state, and updated RNG key.

jaxtari.jax_seaquest.step_enemy_movement(spawn_state: SpawnState, shark_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, sub_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, step_counter: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, rng: Array) → Tuple[Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, SpawnState, Array][source]

Update enemy positions based on their patterns

jaxtari.jax_seaquest.surface_sub_step(state: SeaquestState) → Array | ndarray | bool_ | number[source]
jaxtari.jax_seaquest.update_enemy_spawns(spawn_state: SpawnState, shark_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, sub_positions: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, step_counter: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, rng: Array = None) → Tuple[SpawnState, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, Array][source]

Update enemy spawns using pattern-based system matching original game. :param spawn_state: Current spawn state :param shark_positions: Current shark positions :param sub_positions: Current submarine positions :param step_counter: Current step counter :param rng: Optional random key for direction randomization

Returns:

Tuple of updated spawn state, shark positions, sub positions, and updated RNG key

Update oxygen levels and handle surfacing mechanics with proper surfacing detection

class jaxtari.wrappers.FlattenObservationWrapper(env)[source]

Bases: GymnaxWrapper

Transform the observations of the environment into jnp arrays and flatten. Also changes position of state in the return tuple to comply with gymnax. Always apply this wrapper first.

observation_space() → Box[source]
